Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing a bit better, actually. I started working on my photography project.
That’s fantastic! How has that experience been for you?
It’s been really enjoyable. I cleared out some space in my apartment and set up a little corner for my studio.
That’s wonderful to hear! How does it feel to have that dedicated space for your creativity?
It feels really good. I love having a place where I can focus on my photography without distractions.
That’s great! Have you had a chance to do any portrait photography yet?
Yes, I actually invited a friend over for a mini photo shoot last weekend. It was so much fun!
That sounds amazing! How did it go?
It went really well! We laughed a lot, and I got some great shots. It felt good to be in that creative flow again.
I’m so glad to hear that! It sounds like you’re really finding joy in your photography. Have you noticed any changes in your mood since starting this project?
Yes, definitely. I feel more motivated and less weighed down by negative thoughts.
That’s a significant change! It seems like engaging in creative activities is helping you manage your mood. Have you continued with the mindfulness practice before your sessions?
I have! I’ve been doing it before I start shooting, and it helps me focus.
That’s fantastic! Mindfulness can really enhance your creative process. How do you feel it’s affecting your photography?
I think it helps me be more present. I notice more details and feel less rushed.
That’s a wonderful benefit. Being present can really enhance your artistic expression. Have you thought about any future photography projects or themes you’d like to explore?
I’ve been thinking about doing a series on local landmarks. I want to capture them in different lighting and seasons.
That sounds like a beautiful project! It could also provide you with a sense of purpose and structure. What steps do you think you could take to start this series?
I could make a list of landmarks I want to shoot and plan out some times to go.
That’s a great plan! Setting specific goals can help keep you motivated. How about we set a goal for you to photograph at least two landmarks in the next week?
I like that idea! I’ll aim for that.
Perfect! It’ll be exciting to hear about your experiences next time. Now, let’s check in on those darker thoughts you mentioned previously. Have they come up again?
A little, but I’ve been able to redirect my focus more easily. It’s still there, but it doesn’t consume me as much.
That’s a positive development! It sounds like you’re gaining more control over those thoughts. When they arise, what strategies have you been using to redirect your focus?
I’ve been reminding myself to think about my photography or even just going for a walk to clear my mind.
Those are excellent strategies! Physical activity and creative expression can be very effective in managing negative thoughts. Have you noticed any specific triggers for those thoughts?
I think it happens more when I’m alone for too long or when I’m not busy.
That’s valuable insight. It might be beneficial to create a list of activities you can turn to when you start feeling that way. Would you like to brainstorm some options together?
Sure! I could go for a walk, call a friend, or pick up a book to read.
Those are great options! Having a list can help you act quickly when you start to feel those negative thoughts creeping in.
I’ll make that list. It’ll be helpful.
Wonderful! As we wrap up today, is there anything else you’d like to share or discuss?
I think I’m good for now. I feel like I’m on the right track.
I’m so glad to hear that! Remember, it’s all about progress, not perfection. I’m looking forward to hearing about your photography adventures next time.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time!
Bye!
